labels.analysis: The MCP Server described focuses on workflow automation, allowing users to streamline processes and enhance productivity through the 'run_coze_workflow' tool. This suggests a primary focus on integrating and automating tasks within applications, likely leveraging MCP's capabilities for seamless execution of workflows.

server_info_crawled.name: Coze Workflow
server_info_crawled.author: @sdaaron/coze-workflow-mcp
server_info_crawled.overview: Integrate workflow automation into your applications. Streamline processes and enhance productivity with easy-to-use tools and commands. Leverage the power of MCP to connect your workflows seamlessly.
server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@sdaaron/coze-workflow-mcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
